case_vignette: A 21-year-old male presents to the ED with a stab wound to the right neck. The patient is alert and responsive, and vital signs are stable.
question: Which  neurologic findings would most likely support the diagnosis of right-sided spinal cord hemisection?
correct_ans: right-sided tactile, vibration, and proprioception loss; left-sided pain and temperature sensation loss; right-sided paresis

trial_0.summarized_frq:
Right-sided spinal cord hemisection can cause symptoms such as weakness, numbness, and tingling on the right side of the body. The neurologic findings that would most likely support this diagnosis include:

1. Right-sided weakness in the upper and lower extremities
2. Right-sided numbness or tingling in the arms and legs
3. Right-sided loss of reflexes
4. Right-sided loss of coordination
5. Right-sided loss of balance or gait disturbance
6. Right-sided loss of sensation in the face or neck
7. Right-sided facial weakness or asymmetry
8. Right-sided loss of bladder or bowel control

It is important to note that these symptoms may vary depending on the location and severity of the spinal cord injury. A thorough neurologic examination by a qualified healthcare professional is necessary to make a definitive diagnosis.

trial_3.summarized_frq:
Right-sided spinal cord hemisection is a rare condition that can cause a range of symptoms, including weakness, numbness, and tingling on the right side of the body. The neurologic findings that would most likely support the diagnosis of right-sided spinal cord hemisection include:

1. Weakness on the right side of the body, particularly in the legs and arms.
2. Numbness or tingling on the right side of the body, particularly in the legs and arms.
3. Loss of reflexes on the right side of the body.
4. Difficulty with coordination and balance on the right side of the body.
5. Difficulty with fine motor skills on the right side of the body.

It is important to note that these symptoms may also be caused by other conditions, so a proper diagnosis can only be made after a thorough examination by a qualified medical professional.
